We can assume around Wednesday 23rd, because PBE patches last about 2 weeks, and he was announced 1.5 weeks ago.
Can we still get Ao Shin as well? Are Riot open to champion ideas/concepts? I think it would be sick to see two epic dragons fighting it out on the rift.

Instead of another champ, I think it might be better as a skin. Ao Shin Aurelion Sol. Maybe just Ao Shin. In fact, I think all iceboxed champs would be cool as skins. Priscilla Elise? Seth Azir? Gavid Zyra? Just saying, it would be rather interesting.
Maybe the Ao Shin skin could be a human form of Aurelion Sol. Just an idea

Rat with crossbow vs blind guy, I kind of see it. Badgery-rat with blowgun vs lady with bow and arrow? I kind of see that. Blind guy OR rat OR badger OR lady, vs, CELESTIAL CREATOR OF STARS AND GALAXIES SUPREME BEING? That's just stupid. Shit lore, hope that champ is ok. Getting pretty sick of minigames though.
Perhaps you could settle with blind guy vs "Steve" or "Gary". I think i'm gonna have more trouble trying to play as, with, or against him while trying not to think of jazz hands.

As I understand it that's rather the point. Aurelion Sol does indeed have the power to wipe all of Runeterra out in a single blast of cataclysmic starfire, but he dares not both because of the crown upon his brow bending his will, and the fact that for each defiance he levels against Targon, another star winks out. So while yes, the power levels seem incongruous, the point is that Aurelion Sol is fighting with a tiny, minuscule fraction of his true power so he collateral damage he might cause won't destroy his grand work of millennia, while at the same time allowing himself an opportunity to work free of his bonds.

Trying too hard to be deep and mystical.

If you'd been playing since before they stopped caring very much about lore you'd know that the Summoners (us) use binding magic to set the power of all entities on the Rift to the same level. It's why Cho'Gath can actually fit in a lane, and why Syndra can't just obliterate another Champion by thinking about it.

It was my understanding that they'd scrapped the summoner lore, and thus that any lore written previous to the scrapping was to be taken with a grain of salt. Hence why I didn't try applying old lore logic to a new champion.
